forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a high near 59. South southwest wind 12 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn approaches in Downtown San Francisco, a thick, steady rain envelops the city, casting a subdued gray over the skyline and turning familiar streets into glistening, reflective surfaces. The air carries a cool bite, hinting at the night’s low temperatures, albeit offering a slight lift as they rise into the early morning. The picturesque sight of the Golden Gate Bridge, generally a beacon of vibrant color, seems muted against the heavy clouds, its form lurking in the distance, obscured but defiantly majestic. 

Expect the rain to linger, with relentless bands continuing to soak the city throughout the day. Winds whip up the streets, brisk and unyielding, sending flecks of water dancing in the air. While the precipitation breathes life into a thirsty landscape, it also fosters a contemplative mood, urging you to seek refuge. For today, layering is wise: a water-resistant jacket over a cozy sweater, perhaps with a trusty pair of boots for those who must venture out. There’s comfort to be found in a warm café, where the rain becomes a backdrop to the soft murmur of conversation, inviting you to indulge in a good book or simply watch the world pass by. In this symphony of weather, the mundane becomes profound, transforming a rainy Saturday into a serene retreat.
